title: China Economic Rescue Plan Stalled by Wariness Over Tariffs
content: China is counting on its 1.4 billion consumers to help cushion the blow from Donald Trump’s tariffs. But that strategy is running into a wall of uncertainty, with millions of factory jobs at risk.

title: Stock Futures Rise on Trade Talks, China Rate Cut: Markets Wrap
content: US equity-index futures rose and the dollar snapped three days of declines as the planned trade negotiations between China and the US spurred optimism tensions between the world’s two largest economies are easing.

title: FTSE 100 Live: UK Stocks’ Record Run Tested, Drugmakers Slide
US-China Tariff Pause Reasonable to Expect, Council Head Says
content: Expectations are high that trade talks between US and Chinese officials in Switzerland later this week will result in a tariff reprieve between the two nations, US-China Business Council President Sean Stein said.

title: German Factory Orders Rose Ahead of Trump’s Tariff Push
content: German factory orders rose more than predicted in March, signaling improvement in the run-up to the US tariff announcements that have clouded the outlook for Europe’s largest economy.

title: Chinese Stock Gains Fizzle as Focus Shifts to US Trade Talks
content: Chinese stocks pared earlier gains driven by the central bank’s stimulus, as investors remained wary ahead of trade talks with the US set to start later this week.

title: Oil Extends Gain With US and Chinese Officials Set to Talk Trade
content: Oil pushed higher after rallying more than 3% in the previous session as the US and China agreed to start trade negotiations, raising optimism that tensions between the world’s two biggest economies may ease.

title: Trump Says US Will Stop Houthi Strikes
content: President Trump says the US will stop its bombing campaign against Houthis in Yemen, after a ceasefire was facilitated by Oman. But the Houthis have pledged to keep targeting Israel over its Gaza campaign.  Bloomberg's Dan Williams discusses with Joumanna Bercetche on Horizons Middle East & Africa. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Pakistan Stocks Drop, Indian Assets Steady After Military Strike
content: Pakistan’s stocks slid, while Indian assets were steady after both countries retaliated in expected tit-for-tat blows following a militant attack last month in Kashmir.

title: Shionogi Falls on Report of $1 Billion Offer to Buy Torii Pharma
content: Shares of Japanese drugmaker Shionogi & Co. dropped the most in almost a month after the Nikkei newspaper reported the company will buy Torii Pharmaceutical Co. for about ¥150 billion ($1 billion).

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin  5/7/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bill Gates Discusses Public Health Drives With Indonesia Leader
content: Bill Gates discussed plans to roll out public health initiatives in Indonesia in a meeting with President Prabowo Subianto as the billionaire seeks to expand philanthropic activity in Asia.

title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 5/7/2025
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg: The China Show 05/07/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: India, Pakistan Tensions Risk Further Escalation, Analysts Say
content: India’s targeted military strikes against Pakistan have left analysts debating the possibility of a further escalation in the tensions and its impact on the nations’ economies and markets.

title: US-China Trade Talks to Start This Week
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer will travel later this week to Switzerland for trade talks with China led by Vice Premier He Lifeng, seeking to de-escalate a tariff standoff that has threatened to hammer both economies. Bloomberg's Minmin Low has the latest on what we know so far. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: HK Dollar Interest Rate Falls Most Since 2008 After Intervention
content: The Hong Kong dollar’s funding costs plunged the most since 2008, as the monetary authority’s intervention to defend the currency peg helped boost liquidity in the financial system.

title: China Cuts Key Rate, Reserve Ratio to Aid Economy Hit by Tariffs
content: China reduced its policy rate and lowered the amount of cash lenders must keep in reserve, as Beijing ramps up efforts to help an economy caught in a second trade war with the US.

title: Hot, Dry Weather Threatens Output in China’s Wheat-Growing Belt
content: Hot and dry weather is threatening wheat production in China’s top growing region, potentially disrupting output of a key staple grain just as Beijing attempts to bolster food security during a trade war with the US.

title: India’s Defense Stocks See $5 Billion Rally as Border Tensions Escalate
content: Indian defense firms have added more than $5 billion in market valuation since tensions escalated between the country and neighboring Pakistan following a brutal attack on tourists in Kashmir two weeks ago.

title: China Taps New Animal Feed Sources After Falling Out With Canada
content: Chinese traders are scouring the globe for alternative sources of rapeseed, as tensions with Canada, their top supplier, risk choking imports of a key ingredient in animal feed.

title: Dollar Faces $2.5 Trillion ‘Avalanche’ of Asian Sales, Jen Says
content: The dollar may face a $2.5 trillion “avalanche” of selling as Asian countries unwind their stockpile of the world’s reserve currency, according to Stephen Jen.

title: Taiwan’s Currency Surge Steps Up Pressure for Economic Overhaul
content: The Taiwan dollar’s most extreme surge since 1988, along with prospects for continued appreciation, has triggered calls for one of the most export-dependent Asian economies to overhaul its growth model.

title: A Remote and Disputed Corner of Africa Is Cheering Trump
content: The territory of Western Sahara is turning into an ‘El Dorado’ after the US recognized Morocco’s claim over the region.

title: Czechs Set to Cut Rates But Keep Hawkish Tone
content: Czech policymakers will probably cut interest rates again after inflation slowed more than expected, but they may also signal a lengthy pause is now in store due to persistent price risks.

title: Polish Central Bank to Cut Rates Just Before Election Yet Again
content: Poland’s central bank is set to cut interest rates for the first time since 2023 and like the last time the decision will come just days before an important election.

title: Indian LNG Buyers Embrace US Benchmark to Balance Volatility
content: Indian liquefied natural gas importers have signed a flurry of long-term purchase agreements linked to the US price benchmark, the latest effort by the nation’s buyers to protect themselves from volatile markets.

title: Philippines Signals It Won’t Intervene to Cap Peso Strength
content: Philippine central bank Governor Eli Remolona signaled authorities are unlikely to intervene to curb the strength in the peso, sending the local currency to the highest in more than a year.

title: Iron Ore Climbs on PBOC Reserve Cut, US-China Trade Talks
content: Copper fell and iron ore pared gains after China delivered long-awaited rate cuts to shield the top metals-consuming nation from the impact of US tariffs.

title: 'More Weakness' to Come in US Economy: JPM AM (Correct)
content:
Despite a bounce back in US equities as markets hope for light at the end of the tunnel in Trump's tariff war, there may still be "more weakness to come" in the US economy, according to JPMorgan Asset Management's Kerry Craig. Speaking on Bloomberg TV, Craig adds that while he currently recommends global diversification, the US still has some "really good, high quality" companies that will continue to deliver.

(Corrects the bank name in headline and description.) (Source: Bloomberg)

title: China Economic Rescue Plan Stalled by Wariness Over Tariffs
content: China is counting on its 1.4 billion consumers to help cushion the blow from Donald Trump’s tariffs. But that strategy is running into a wall of uncertainty, with millions of factory jobs at risk.

title: Malaysia Economy Minister Rafizi Says Ready to Quit Cabinet
content: Malaysia’s Economy Minister Rafizi Ramli said he is prepared to step down from the cabinet to focus on campaigning for the next general election that’s due in early 2028.

title: UK Defends India Trade Deal From Farage and Tory Attack on Tax
content: The UK’s Labour government has defended its new trade deal with India, after opposition parties said British workers would be undercut by an agreement for some Indian nationals to pay less tax.

title: Merz Heads to Paris and Warsaw After Bumpy Start as Chancellor
content: Friedrich Merz travels to Paris and Warsaw on Wednesday on his first foreign trip as German chancellor, still reeling from a humiliating setback in Tuesday’s government transition that raised early questions about his leadership.

title: China and Russia Put Stalled Gas Pipeline on Moscow Talks Agenda
content: Talks between Chinese leader Xi Jinping and Russia’s Vladimir Putin this week will include negotiations around a much-delayed natural gas pipeline connecting the two economies, reviving discussions hampered for years by disagreements on the cost, route and urgency of the project.

title: South Korea Court to Hear Presidential Lead Candidate’s Case After Polls
content: South Korea’s high court delayed its first hearing on sentencing leading presidential candidate Lee Jae-myung over a legal violation until after the upcoming election, enabling him to run for the country’s top office.

title: India, Pakistan Trade Military Strikes After Kashmir Attack
content: India conducted targeted military strikes against Pakistan, which said it retaliated in expected tit-for-tat blows after a militant attack last month in Kashmir that killed 26 people.

title: Chinese Regulator Applauds Warren Buffett’s Long-Term Approach
content: China’s top securities regulator has become a surprising addition to the chorus of voices praising Warren Buffett, after the legendary investor announced his plan to step down as chief executive of Berkshire Hathaway Inc.

title: South Korea Presidential Hopeful Han Vows to Create AI Ministry
content: South Korea’s former acting leader and current presidential hopeful Han Duck-soo vowed Wednesday to launch a new ministry to oversee the country’s artificial intelligence strategies and science innovation if he wins the election.

title: Moscow Downs Drones for Third Day With Xi, Lula Due to Visit
content: Russia’s air defense shot down nine drones flying toward Moscow, the capital’s mayor said, in an incident coming just before foreign leaders including the presidents of China and Brazil are expected in the city for Victory Day celebrations.

title: US-China Trade Talks to Start This Week as Tariffs Start to Bite
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer will travel later this week to Switzerland for trade talks with China led by Vice Premier He Lifeng, seeking to de-escalate a tariff standoff that has threatened to hammer both economies.

title: US Antisemitism Probe Hits Anti-Boeing Acts on Seattle Campus
content: A Trump administration task force on antisemitism said Tuesday that it will review Gaza-related protests and vandalism at the University of Washington targeting Boeing Co. and a new engineering building the company helped fund.

title: A Remote and Disputed Corner of Africa Is Cheering Trump
content: The territory of Western Sahara is turning into an ‘El Dorado’ after the US recognized Morocco’s claim over the region.

title: Romanian Far-Right Trump Acolyte Plans Milei-Style Spending Cuts
content: Romania’s far-right leader, the resounding first-round winner of the nation’s presidential election, said he found inspiration in Argentina’s chainsaw-wielding president when asked about how he would address the country’s economic woes.

title: Conclave for a New Pope Begins With Faithful Seeking Direction
content: Roman Catholic cardinals from across the globe are heading to the Sistine Chapel to choose a new pope, who will set the moral compass for the Church’s 1.4 billion faithful and become a reference point for much of the world.

title: Machado Aides Escape Venezuela After 15-Month Embassy Siege
content: Five top aides of Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado escaped the country after the US helped them foil a siege of the Argentine Embassy in Caracas where they had been holed up for 15 months.

title: Airlines Avoid Pakistan Airspace as Tensions With India Rise
content: Commercial jets have streamed out of Pakistani airspace, leaving the skies effectively empty, after targeted military strikes by India sparked a dramatic escalation in tensions between the countries.

title: What’s Behind the Enduring India-Pakistan Conflict?
content: Two weeks after a deadly attack on tourists in Kashmir on April 22, India announced that it had conducted “precise and restrained” strikes on what it called “terrorist camps” in neighboring Pakistan. Pakistan said it had shot down five Indian planes in retaliation.

title: World’s Trade Superhighway Feels Strain From US-China Decoupling
content: Container liners are starting to sever shipping routes that link the US and China across the Pacific, as President Donald Trump’s trade war upends the industry and forces the two largest economies apart.

title: NZ’s Willis Sought Meeting on Bank Capital Before Orr Quit RBNZ
content: New Zealand Finance Minister Nicola Willis sought a meeting with former Reserve Bank Governor Adrian Orr to discuss bank capital requirements in the weeks prior to his sudden resignation, documents released under the Official Information Act show.

title: Pakistan Says Five Indian Planes Shot Down
content: Pakistan said it shot down five Indian airplanes in retaliation to Indian military strikes early Wednesday.

title: Prabowo’s Transition Pains Emerge as Drag on Indonesian Growth
content: While Indonesia’s economic growth was largely expected to slow in the first quarter, few predicted a key drag would come from President Prabowo Subianto’s new government.

title: Trump Can’t Deport Alleged Gang Members Under Alien Enemies Act, NY Judge Rules
content: Courts in New York and Colorado blocked the Trump administration from using a two-century old law to deport alleged Venezuelan gang members, following a similar ruling by a judge in Texas last week.

title: Republicans Weigh Medicaid Work Requirements for Adults Under 65
content: House Republicans are considering establishing work requirements for able-bodied Medicaid recipients starting at age 18 and through age 64, New York Representative Nicole Malliotakis said Tuesday.

title: Lawyers Are Quoting $1 Million in Fees to Get Pardons to Trump
content: One pardon recipient recalls the president telling him, ‘You’re cleaner than a baby’s bottom.’

title: India, Pakistan Tensions Escalate After Airstrikes
content: Army soldiers examine a building damaged by a suspected Indian missile attack near Muzaffarabad, the capital of Pakistan controlled Kashmir, on, May 7, 2025.

title: Trump Drug Price Idea Could Cost Industry $1 Trillion, Lobbying Group Says
content: The pharmaceutical industry estimates President Donald Trump’s new drug pricing proposal could cost drug companies as much as $1 trillion over a decade, its largest trade group is telling members of Congress.

title: Duffy Says Air Traffic Overhaul to Cost Tens of Billions of Dollars
content: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said Tuesday that his proposal to overhaul the US’s air traffic system, which he plans to unveil May 8, will cost “tens of billions” of dollars.

title: China Condemns CIA Videos That Try to Lure Disaffected Officials
content: China condemned the Central Intelligence Agency’s attempts to recruit its disenchanted citizens and warned of retaliation, days after the release of videos encouraging officials to spy for the US.

title: Trump Downplays Trade Negotiations, Says He’ll Dictate Terms
content: US President Donald Trump said he would prescribe tariff levels and trade concessions for partners looking to avoid higher duties, appearing to move away from the idea that he would engage in back-and-forth negotiations.

content: Absa Group Ltd. named the former head of banking supervision at the South African Reserve Bank as chairman, after the incumbent said he’ll resign.

title: Hon Hai to Make Mitsubishi an EV for Australia, New Zealand
content: Hon Hai Precision Industry Co. has agreed to supply Mitsubishi Motors Corp. with an electric vehicle that will be manufactured in Taiwan, and sold in Australia and New Zealand by the end of 2026.

title: BMW Earnings Drop on China Slump as Tariffs Cloud Outlook
content: BMW AG’s earnings plunged 23% in the first quarter as intense competition in China pushed sales in its biggest single market to a five-year low.

title: Legrand Saw ‘Outstanding’ Data Center Growth Amid AI Boom
content: Legrand SA’s first-quarter sales surpassed expectations as the artificial intelligence boom led to “outstanding” growth for data centers.

title: Bitcoin Rises as US-China Trade Talks Spark Bullish Crypto Bets
content: Bitcoin rose alongside Asian stocks and a strengthening dollar after news that the US and China plan to hold trade talks.

title: AMD’s Bullish Sales Outlook Tempered by China Concerns
content: Advanced Micro Devices Inc., Nvidia Corp.’s closest rival in artificial intelligence processors, said that US restrictions on sales to China will cost $1.5 billion in revenue this year, a warning that clouded an otherwise upbeat outlook.

title: Super Micro Gives Weak Outlook on Customer Purchase Delays
content: Super Micro Computer Inc. gave a sales forecast in the current period that fell short of estimates, disappointing investors after the server maker last week released lackluster preliminary quarterly results for the previous quarter.

title: Google Reserves Key Search Data for Gemini, Not Rival AI Apps
content: Google last year began offering some artificial intelligence firms a way to anchor chatbot responses in its search results, but still reserves key features for its own AI service, Gemini, a company executive testified.

title: Instagram Suggested ‘Groomers’ Connect With Minors, FTC Says
content: Instagram’s automated software systems recommended that child “groomers” connect with minors on the app, making it easier for them to find victims, according to a 2019 internal document presented in court by the Federal Trade Commission.

title: Marvell Sinks After Delaying Investor Day Due to Shaky Economy
content: Marvell Technology Inc. shares fell more than 6% in extended trading after the chipmaker cut the high end of its revenue forecast and postponed an investor day event, citing the “uncertain” economy.

title: IBM Doubles Down on AI, Palantir Falls Short | Bloomberg Technology
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde speaks with IBM CEO Arvind Krishna about the company’s new product designed to help enterprises manage the growing number of AI agents. Plus, Janet Mui, head of market analysis at RBC Brewin Dolphin, reacts to Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent's testimony where he said that there is no sign of a recession in the US. And a leader in Palantir’s army of loyal retail investors discusses why he isn't concerned about the company’s slow global growth. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: OpenAI’s For-Profit Overhaul Is Far From Being a Done Deal
content: For much of the past year, OpenAI has been pushing ahead with a complicated effort to turn itself from a nonprofit into a more conventional moneymaking business that would be more appealing to investors — and doing so over heated objections from former employees, academics and rivals, including Elon Musk.

title: OpenAI’s Scaled-Back Corporate Overhaul Is Not A Done Deal
content: OpenAI’s concession on its for-profit conversion may not be enough to win over some critics. But first…

title: Nvidia CEO Says China AI Market Is on Course to Hit $50 Billion
content: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang said that the market for AI chips in China could reach $50 billion in the next couple of years, making it crucial for US companies to have access to the country.

title: AMD, Arm Offer Window Into AI Landscape Ahead of Nvidia Earnings
content: Two chipmakers reporting earnings in the coming days will give investors insight into how demand for artificial intelligence infrastructure is holding up a few weeks ahead of Nvidia Corp.’s results.

title: Swedish Podcast Conglomerate PodX Acquires Lemonada Media for Around $30 Million
content: The network behind podcasts from Julia Louis-Dreyfus and Meghan Markle will be PodX Group’s first US-based acquisition

title: DoorDash Is on a $5 Billion Buying Spree After Earnings Beat
content: In a matter of five hours, the US delivery firm DoorDash Inc. announced two multibillion-dollar acquisitions that stand to turn what is already the largest food-delivery service in the US into a formidable global player. It agreed to buy London-based delivery Deliveroo Plc for 180 pence per share, or about £2.9 billion ($3.9 billion), and it’s acquiring hospitality tech company SevenRooms Inc. for $1.2 billion.

title: Palantir Slides by Most in a Year as Sales Forecast Falls Short
content: Palantir Technologies Inc. shares slid by the most in nearly a year after its financial results and projections failed to live up to investors’ lofty expectations.

title: Brian Armstrong’s Human Life Extension Venture Raises Fresh Cash
content: Brian Armstrong’s NewLimit, the longevity startup founded by the Coinbase Inc. executive that’s aiming to extend human life through reprogramming human genes, raised a new round of funding that values the company at $810 million.

title: Instacart Debuts ‘Fizz’ Alcohol Ordering App to Target Gen Z Users
content: Instacart is launching a new, Gen-Z focused app for group orders of drinks and party snacks, expanding its core delivery business beyond grocery hauls.

title: Uber to Buy $700 Million Stake in Turkish Delivery App Trendyol
content: Uber Technologies Inc. agreed to buy 85% of a Turkish food and grocery delivery platform controlled by Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd., in the latest example of consolidation in the global food-delivery industry.

title: Microsoft Debuts Lower-End Surface Devices to Push AI Tools
content: Microsoft Corp. is rolling out two lower-end versions of its main Surface devices in a bid to drum up interest in computers that can take advantage of the company’s artificial intelligence tools and better compete with Apple Inc.’s range of slim devices.

title: Trump-Era Cuts, Harvard Fight Threaten Biotech’s Riskiest Bets
content: The Trump administration’s sweeping cuts of federal research funding and its fight with Harvard University risk bleeding into the venture capital market, curbing financing opportunities for early-stage drug development.

title: General Catalyst Co-Leads AI Funding Deal Valuing Parloa at $1 Billion
content: Parloa GmbH, a startup building an artificial intelligence platform for customer service, has raised $120 million from investors in a deal that values the company at $1 billion.

title: What US and EU Crackdowns on Big Tech Mean for Apple, Google, X
content: For years, the world’s biggest technology companies were largely able to resist government oversight. That’s changing fast.

title: Tech’s Strong Earnings Results Obscured by Tariff Uncertainty
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ian King reports that tech’s quarterly results have been pretty good other than the confusion over the costs of escalating US tariffs.

title: Grubhub Owner Wonder Tops $7 Billion Valuation in New Funding
content: Marc Lore’s food hall startup is raising $600 million from investors including NEA, Accel and GV.

title: DLocal CEO Sees E-Commerce Firms Rushing Into Milei’s Argentina
content: Merchants selling everything from electronics, consumer goods and streaming services are coming back to Argentina as President Javier Milei unwinds years of controls, according to the the top executive at payment services provider DLocal Ltd.

title: WiseTech’s White Takes Stage Pledging ‘Top Quality’ Governance
content: WiseTech Global Ltd. Executive Chairman Richard White returned to the public stage with a vigorous pledge to improve corporate oversight, a little more than two months after he reasserted his control of the scandal-plagued company in a boardroom cleanout.

title: Philips Cuts Margin Guidance Over US-China Trade Tensions
content: Royal Philips NV lowered its profitability outlook for the year due to the cost of dealing with rising trade hurdles.

title: Danish Obesity Startup Ousia Gets Funds From US Investor Omega
content: The US venture capital firm Omega Funds is backing a Danish biotech startup, betting it can deliver a new type of obesity treatment.

title: DoorDash Agrees to Buy Deliveroo in $3.9 Billion Deal
content: DoorDash Inc. has agreed to buy UK-based food-delivery platform Deliveroo Plc for an equity value of about £2.9 billion ($3.9 billion), as the US company pushes into more overseas markets.

title: Staking Firm Figment Hunts Acquisitions Amid Crypto Deal Spree
content: Figment is looking for acquisition targets, potentially extending a flurry of dealmaking in the digital-assets space triggered by President Donald Trump’s pro-crypto agenda.

title: China Economic Rescue Plan Stalled by Wariness Over Tariffs
content: China is counting on its 1.4 billion consumers to help cushion the blow from Donald Trump’s tariffs. But that strategy is running into a wall of uncertainty, with millions of factory jobs at risk.

title: UK Defends India Trade Deal From Farage and Tory Attack on Tax
content: The UK’s Labour government has defended its new trade deal with India, after opposition parties said British workers would be undercut by an agreement for some Indian nationals to pay less tax.

title: German Factory Orders Rose Ahead of Trump’s Tariff Push
content: German factory orders rose more than predicted in March, signaling improvement in the run-up to the US tariff announcements that have clouded the outlook for Europe’s largest economy.

title: Chinese Stock Gains Fizzle as Focus Shifts to US Trade Talks
content: Chinese stocks pared earlier gains driven by the central bank’s stimulus, as investors remained wary ahead of trade talks with the US set to start later this week.

title: China and Russia Put Stalled Gas Pipeline on Moscow Talks Agenda
content: Talks between Chinese leader Xi Jinping and Russia’s Vladimir Putin this week will include negotiations around a much-delayed natural gas pipeline connecting the two economies, reviving discussions hampered for years by disagreements on the cost, route and urgency of the project.

title: Sweden Core Inflation Surprises With Smaller-Than-Expected Gain
content: Sweden’s underlying inflation accelerated less than expected last month, likely feeding expectations that the Riksbank will resume easing to aid the sluggish economy.

title: UK Market Volatility Adds to Bets BOE Will Pause Bond Sales
content: Investors will seek clues over the future of the Bank of England’s bond-selling program at its monetary policy meeting on Thursday, amid speculation that recent market turmoil may encourage officials to cease it later this year.

title: China Cuts Key Rate, Reserve Ratio to Aid Economy Hit by Tariffs
content: China reduced its policy rate and lowered the amount of cash lenders must keep in reserve, as Beijing ramps up efforts to help an economy caught in a second trade war with the US.

title: US-China Trade Talks to Start This Week as Tariffs Start to Bite
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer will travel later this week to Switzerland for trade talks with China led by Vice Premier He Lifeng, seeking to de-escalate a tariff standoff that has threatened to hammer both economies.

title: Taiwan’s Currency Surge Steps Up Pressure for Economic Overhaul
content: The Taiwan dollar’s most extreme surge since 1988, along with prospects for continued appreciation, has triggered calls for one of the most export-dependent Asian economies to overhaul its growth model.

title: The Home of Bollywood and India’s Big Banks Faces Growing Cyclone Risk
content: Mumbai remains perilously unprepared even as the devastating storms grow more frequent.

title: A Remote and Disputed Corner of Africa Is Cheering Trump
content: The territory of Western Sahara is turning into an ‘El Dorado’ after the US recognized Morocco’s claim over the region.

title: Czechs Set to Cut Rates But Keep Hawkish Tone
content: Czech policymakers will probably cut interest rates again after inflation slowed more than expected, but they may also signal a lengthy pause is now in store due to persistent price risks.

title: Polish Central Bank to Cut Rates Just Before Election Yet Again
content: Poland’s central bank is set to cut interest rates for the first time since 2023 and like the last time the decision will come just days before an important election.

title: Philippines BSP Chief Open to 75 Basis Points More Cuts for 2025
content: The Philippine central bank is open to cutting its key interest rate by a further 75 basis points for the rest of the year as inflation continued to ease, according to Governor Eli Remolona.

title: World’s Trade Superhighway Feels Strain From US-China Decoupling
content: Container liners are starting to sever shipping routes that link the US and China across the Pacific, as President Donald Trump’s trade war upends the industry and forces the two largest economies apart.

title: NZ’s Willis Sought Meeting on Bank Capital Before Orr Quit RBNZ
content: New Zealand Finance Minister Nicola Willis sought a meeting with former Reserve Bank Governor Adrian Orr to discuss bank capital requirements in the weeks prior to his sudden resignation, documents released under the Official Information Act show.

title: Prabowo’s Transition Pains Emerge as Drag on Indonesian Growth
content: While Indonesia’s economic growth was largely expected to slow in the first quarter, few predicted a key drag would come from President Prabowo Subianto’s new government.

title: New Zealand Jobless Rate Holds Steady as Fewer People Seek Work
content: New Zealand’s jobless rate unexpectedly held steady in the first quarter as fewer people sought work in a sluggish economy.

title: Fed to Hold Rates Steady as Pressures Mount
content: Federal Reserve officials are widely expected to leave interest rates unchanged Wednesday as they await clarity on the Trump administration’s trade policies, a move likely to frustrate the president and anyone else seeking answers about the US central bank’s next move.

title: Lawyers Are Quoting $1 Million in Fees to Get Pardons to Trump
content: One pardon recipient recalls the president telling him, ‘You’re cleaner than a baby’s bottom.’

title: Trump Downplays Trade Negotiations, Says He’ll Dictate Terms
content: US President Donald Trump said he would prescribe tariff levels and trade concessions for partners looking to avoid higher duties, appearing to move away from the idea that he would engage in back-and-forth negotiations.

title: UK and US in Intensive Talks on Economic Deal to Reduce Tariffs
content: The UK and US are in intensive discussions about an economic agreement that would reduce the impact of some tariffs, with a team of British officials in Washington to negotiate terms this week, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Senators Push Legislation Giving Fed an Independent Watchdog
content: Senators Rick Scott and Elizabeth Warren are pushing for an independent watchdog at the Federal Reserve to “aggressively hold” senior Fed officials accountable.

title: EU Eyes €100 Billion of US Goods With Tariffs If Talks Fail
content: The European Union plans to hit about €100 billion ($113 billion) in US goods with additional tariffs in the event ongoing trade talks fail to yield a satisfactory result for the bloc, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: US-Ireland Trade Deficit at Record on Pre-Tariff Pharma Imports
content: The US merchandise-trade deficit with Ireland soared to a record in March on a massive inflow of pharmaceutical and medicines, likely a preemptive move by drug companies to front-run expected tariffs.

title: US Student Loan Rate Set to Be 6.39%, Extending Borrower Squeeze
content: Borrowing costs on student loans for the next academic year will likely be near a 15-year high.

title: UK Seeks Firmer EU Support for Joining €150 Billion Defense Fund
content: The UK is pressing the European Union to more clearly back British participation in a €150 billion ($170 billion) defense fund after the first draft of a proposed security pact was largely silent on the demand, according to UK officials and documents seen by Bloomberg.

title: Panama Seeks US Cooperation Without Taking Sides
content: Panama expects more cooperation with the US but is avoiding taking sides in a trade war between the world’s two largest economies, according to its finance chief.

title: World’s Biggest Zinc Mine Gets Caught in US-China Tariff Turmoil
content: The owner of the world’s largest zinc mine is in discussions to reroute output of the US operation away from China due to the trade war between Washington and Beijing, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Novo Trims Forecast as Obesity Competition Curbs Growth
content: Novo Nordisk A/S trimmed its forecasts as sales of the drugmaker’s blockbuster obesity and diabetes medicines struggle with competition in the US.

title: China and Russia Put Stalled Gas Pipeline on Moscow Talks Agenda
content: Talks between Chinese leader Xi Jinping and Russia’s Vladimir Putin this week will include negotiations around a much-delayed natural gas pipeline connecting the two economies, reviving discussions hampered for years by disagreements on the cost, route and urgency of the project.

title: Oil Extends Gain With US and Chinese Officials Set to Talk Trade
content: Oil pushed higher after rallying more than 3% in the previous session as the US and China agreed to start trade negotiations, raising optimism that tensions between the world’s two biggest economies may ease.

title: DNB Income Tops Estimates as Clients Seek Advice Amid Turmoil
content: DNB Bank ASA, Norway’s largest bank, reported better-than-estimated lending profit driven by volume growth and said it’s seeing more clients seek advice on how to deal with turbulent markets.

title: Temu, Shein See US Sales Drop in Week After Tariff Price Hikes
content: Shein Group Ltd. and Temu saw double-digit sales declines in the week after they raised retail prices to cover the costs of increased US tariffs, an initial sign that Donald Trump’s punitive trade measures have taken a toll on the shopping platforms’ popularity.

title: How a CEO’s Faked Results Led to a $300 Million Wipeout
content: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast, we look at the fakery that led to the collapse of eFishery and what it can tell us about the risks of investing in Indonesia

title: China Taps New Animal Feed Sources After Falling Out With Canada
content: Chinese traders are scouring the globe for alternative sources of rapeseed, as tensions with Canada, their top supplier, risk choking imports of a key ingredient in animal feed.

title: Rivian Cuts EV Delivery Outlook, Sees Tariff Impact
content: Rivian Automotive Inc. said full-year deliveries will decline more sharply than it anticipated just a month ago, citing risks that President Donald Trump’s trade war will further dampen demand for pricey electric vehicles.

title: Airlines Avoid Pakistan Airspace as Tensions With India Rise
content: Commercial jets have streamed out of Pakistani airspace, leaving the skies effectively empty, after targeted military strikes by India sparked a dramatic escalation in tensions between the countries.

title: UOB Halts 2025 Guidance on Uncertainty; Profit Growth Stalls
content: United Overseas Bank Ltd. withheld its 2025 guidance amid economic uncertainties as the Singapore lender delivered first-quarter profit that was marked by a rise in provisions.

title: I Squared Group Agrees to Buy Matterhorn Express Pipeline Stake
content: I Squared Capital and other companies have reached a deal to acquire equity interests in the Matterhorn Express Pipeline from Ridgemont Equity Partners and Devon Energy Corp.

title: Milken Private-Credit Crowd Spots ‘Golden’ Moment Amid Chaos
content: Some of the biggest players in private credit are anticipating profits from the chaos unleashed by President Donald Trump’s tariffs, even as the volatility exposes risks lurking in the opaque market.

title: Barclays, StanChart Face Investor Pressure to Fund Clean Power
content: As UK politicians of all stripes push back on the feasibility of racing toward a low-carbon future, investors in the country’s biggest banks refuse to lose sight of that goal.

title: Duffy Says Air Traffic Overhaul to Cost Tens of Billions of Dollars
content: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said Tuesday that his proposal to overhaul the US’s air traffic system, which he plans to unveil May 8, will cost “tens of billions” of dollars.

title: WeightWatchers Files Bankruptcy as GLP-1 Drugs Reshape Market
content: WeightWatchers, known for its diet programs once endorsed by celebrities including Oprah Winfrey, has filed for bankruptcy after struggling to compete with weight-loss drugs like Ozempic.

title: Trump’s Copper Tariff Probe Is Expected Soon, Industry Group Says
content: US authorities are expected to decide on copper tariffs well before a year-end deadline, according to a trade group.

title: CFTC Employees Sidelined in Fallout From My Forex Funds Case
content: The US Commodity Futures Trading Commission has put four lawyers and an investigator on administrative leave amid allegations of employee misconduct in a fraud case against an online trading platform, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: TPG to Buy Peppertree as It Pushes Into Infrastructure Investing
content: TPG Inc. is buying wireless tower investment firm Peppertree Capital Management as the alternative asset manager expands further into digital infrastructure.

title: Holcim Leases Space in Downtown Chicago for Planned US Spinoff
content: Swiss cement company Holcim Ltd. said it will relocate its planned North American spinoff to downtown Chicago.

title: Allegiant Joins Rivals in Pulling Outlook as Economy Chills
content: Allegiant Travel Co. withdrew its full-year financial outlook, citing a slowdown in air travel demand due to economic uncertainty and falling consumer confidence.

title: Inside Newark Airport’s Chilling 90-Second Blackout
content: When the computer screens shut off without warning, the room erupted in panic. First came curses, then tears.

title: Ex-Brazil Central Bank Head Campos Neto to Join Nu in July
content: Former Brazil central bank Governor Roberto Campos Neto, who oversaw the launch of the wildly popular instant payments platform known as Pix, will join Nu Holdings Ltd., one of the world’s largest digital banks, when his garden leave ends in July.

title: CVS’s Strong Results Lead Activist Glenview to Pare Stake
content: Activist investor Glenview Capital Management sold 3.75 million shares of CVS Health Corp. — about a third of its stake — and said it was pleased with recent changes at the health care conglomerate.

title: Hedge Funds Caxton, Kapitalo Hire Former Itau’s Treasury Traders
content: Two former traders at Itau Unibanco Holding SA’s treasury desk are joining hedge funds Caxton Associates and Kapitalo Investimentos, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: EU Eyes €100 Billion of US Goods With Tariffs If Talks Fail
content: The European Union plans to hit about €100 billion ($113 billion) in US goods with additional tariffs in the event ongoing trade talks fail to yield a satisfactory result for the bloc, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: KKR-Backed Crescent Energy Weighs Asset Sales to Focus on Eagle Ford, Uinta Basins
content: Crescent Energy Co., a US oil-and-gas explorer backed by KKR & Co., is looking to slim down its drilling portfolio to focus on its core acreage in the Eagle Ford and Uinta basins, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: 23andMe Expects Multiple Bids for Genetic Data, Lawyer Says
content: Multiple bidders are likely to submit offers for the DNA data bank and other assets of bankrupt genetic-testing firm 23andMe, according to a lawyer for the company.

title: Vonovia Taps Vodafone CFO Mucic to Succeed Buch as CEO
content: Germany’s largest landlord, Vonovia, tapped Vodafone Group Plc Chief Financial Officer Luka Mucic to replace Rolf Buch, who is stepping down as chief executive officer at the end of the year.

title: Oil Gains From Four-Year Low on Signs US Output Is Set to Fall
content: Oil climbed from the lowest closing price in four years on signs that production from the US may contract in the months ahead.

title: Standard Bank’s Asset Manager Eyes East Africa Growth
content: Africa’s biggest bank plans to grow the market share of its asset management business in East Africa to take advantage of the continent’s fastest growing region.

title: Credit Suisse to pay $511M for helping Americans evade $4B in taxes
content: Credit Suisse has pleaded guilty to criminal charges and agreed to pay $511 million for helping wealthy Americans hide more than $4 billion.

title: The AP Will Not Change Nick Ut's Credit on 'Napalm Girl' Photo
content: The AP has released an extensive report looking at whether Nick Ut is the author of the Vietnam War Napalm Girl image.

title: Royal Credit Union partnering with local non-profits for diaper drive
content: Donations will be accepted between May 1 and May 31, 2025.

title: Newsom suggests tax credit for Hollywood after Trump proposes tariffs on foreign films
content: California Gov. Gavin Newsom reached out to the Trump administration on Monday with hopes that the two can pair up and create a $7.5 billion federal film tax credit to help out the movie business.

title: How holding rates steady affects you
content: From credit cards and mortgage rates to auto loans and savings accounts, all sorts of consumer borrowing costs are impacted by Fed moves.

title: Credit Suisse fined for helping rich Americans hide over $4 billion from the taxman
content: A Credit Suisse unit has pleaded guilty to US charges of helping ultra-wealthy Americans evade taxes and will pay a fine of more than $510 million.

title: Trump overhypes $5 trillion in private US investments pledges
content: Presidents often claim credit for the good things that happen while they’re in office. But Trump is taking things to a new level.

title: Royal Credit Union named Diamond Awards recipient amid record-breaking competition
content: “We are so proud of this accomplishment!” said Andrea Finn, Royal’s marketing manager.

title: Visa launches ‘Intelligent Commerce’ platform, letting AI agents swipe your card-safely, it says
content: Visa launches Intelligent Commerce platform enabling AI assistants to make secure purchases with your credit card, transforming online shopping with personalized automation and consumer-controlled spending limits.

title: Student loan collections resume as record number of borrowers fall behind on payments
content: TransUnion, one of the three major credit bureaus, found that one in five student loan borrowers is at risk of defaulting.

content: The SEC’s Office of Investor Education and Advocacy unveiled its anti-fraud public service campaign, which warns investors about the devastating impact relationship investment scams can have on their financial future.

content: April is Financial Literacy Month, and the SEC is encouraging investors to utilize the agency’s saving and investing resources on Investor.gov.

title: SEC to Host Roundtable on Artificial Intelligence
content: The SEC will hold a roundtable discussion on artificial intelligence and examine the risks, benefits, and governance of it in the financial industry.

title: How Embedded Finance Is Quietly Transforming Startup Business Models
content: Traditional banks are having a hard time keeping up with customers' expectations for embedded finance. In this guest commentary, Arthur Azizov, founder and investor at B2 Ventures, provides some answers to what customers want and why they want it.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Forget Startups. Maybe The Most Adaptable Companies Are Those That Last Centuries
content: Building a lasting business can take an exceedingly long time, but it's nothing compared to hundreds of well-known, successful organizations and brands that can trace their roots back not in years or decades but in centuries. Here's a look at a few of them.

title: With Turo Withdrawal, A Slim IPO Pipeline Gets Thinner
content: Peer-to-peer car rental platform Turo became the latest venture unicorn to withdraw plans for a public offering.

title: Adapting The IPO Roadmap For Today’s Market
content: The path to IPO has become slower and more arduous for companies looking for an exit, writes Fiunder Shield's COO Carl Niedbala. In this guest commentary he lays out some effective measures to help founders be prepared when an opportunity presents itself.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
content: Global venture funding totaled $23 billion in April 2025, flat year over year and down significantly month over month from $68 billion invested in March, Crunchbase data shows.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.

title: Seed Funding Rose In These Spaces
content: Even as overall seed-stage investment declined in 2024, a few areas saw big gains. This includes the obvious category — AI — as well as a subset of sectors largely focused on automating things that humans currently do. We take a look at four top picks.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.
